definition: to throw amorous or flirtatious glances at sb (esp. of a woman)
to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
flatter/charm
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: I winked at Keith who laughed.
sentences.chinese: 我向基斯抛媚眼，他笑了。

sentences.english: Tom ogles on a pretty boy.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆给一个靓仔抛媚眼。

sentences.english: Did you just make eyes at him?
sentences.chinese: 妳刚刚在对他抛媚眼吗？

sentences.english: He ogled a lady in the pub。
sentences.chinese: 他在酒吧里向一位女士抛媚眼。

sentences.english: They were looking at me, and leering.
sentences.chinese: 他们全都看着我，给我抛媚眼。

sentences.english: See , he is giving me the eye.
I think that girl winked at me.
sentences.chinese: 我想那个女孩在朝我抛媚眼。

sentences.english: You are makin' googoo eyes on my girl?
sentences.chinese: 喔喔喔哥们你敢对我的女人抛媚眼？

definition: to cast flirtatious glances at sb (idiom)
to cast flirtatious glances at sb (idiom)
charming eyes/coquettish glances
to be particularly attentive to (an attractive young lady or man etc)/to fawn upon (an influential politician etc)/to court sb's favor/to ingratiate oneself
to stroke one's hair coquettishly (idiom)
to make eyes/to wink
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
lustful/lecherous
to blow a kiss
see 色瞇瞇|色眯眯[se4 mi1 mi1]
to make sheep eyes at/to cast amorous glances at
lit. eyes and eyebrows come and go (idiom); to make eyes/to exchange flirting glances with sb
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
to whistle
enchanting smile
full of tender feelings (idiom); tender-hearted
